::: column-body
<font size= "5"> **First Year PhD Student in [Biomedical Engineering](https://www.bme.jhu.edu/) at [Johns Hopkins University](https://www.jhu.edu/)** </font>

At present, my research endeavors are centered on the elucidation of the optimal applications of
machine learning on live cell imaging, towards gaining deeper insights into the 
morphological and motility-based heterogeneity exhibited by cells in both physiological and 
pathological contexts. Moreover, I have recently devised a novel algorithmic framework for 
unraveling cellular heterogeneity within complex omics datasets for subtype discovery. My proficiencies lie in the 
domains of data analysis, machine learning, and the development and implementation of high-end 
computational research tools.

I would like to continue to integrate machine learning and live cell imaging to analyze the complexities of cellular dynamics 
and/or pathophysiological conditions. I am also interested in exploring novel ways to combine multimodal data via Artificial 
Intelligence, and would enjoy pursuing more wet lab work!

In my spare time I love to watch and play sports, hang out with friends, and run!
